questions.question: What is a blockchain?
options: A digital ledger that stores data in blocks linked together in a chain.
A social media platform for cryptocurrencies.
A centralized server for storing passwords.
A programming language used for Bitcoin.

questions.question: What is a block in a blockchain?
options: A unit that stores transaction data, a timestamp, and a reference to the previous block.
A code used to encrypt files on the network.
A wallet for storing digital coins.
A user account on the blockchain.

questions.question: Who created Bitcoin, the first blockchain?
options: Satoshi Nakamoto
Elon Musk
Vitalik Buterin
Mark Zuckerberg

questions.question: What does 'decentralized' mean in blockchain?
options: No single person or organization controls the network.
The government fully controls the data.
All information is stored on one central computer.
It runs only on company servers.

questions.question: What is a transaction in blockchain?
options: An exchange of information or value recorded permanently on the blockchain.
A printed document signed by two parties.
A message sent through email.
A request to delete old data from the chain.

questions.question: What is cryptocurrency?
options: A digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security.
A type of credit card.
A form of physical coin.
A password used for banking.

questions.question: What is Bitcoin?
options: The first cryptocurrency built using blockchain technology.
A type of stock traded on the exchange.
A central bank application.
A programming framework.

questions.question: What is Ethereum known for?
options: Supporting smart contracts and decentralized applications (dApps).
Being the first cryptocurrency.
Managing cloud storage servers.
Mining only Bitcoin transactions.

questions.question: What is a smart contract?
options: A self-executing contract with the terms written directly into code.
A paper contract signed digitally.
A government agreement for software projects.
An encrypted chat program.

questions.question: What is mining in blockchain?
options: The process of validating transactions and adding new blocks to the blockchain.
Digging for cryptocurrency hardware.
Creating websites about Bitcoin.
Downloading blockchain wallets.

questions.question: What is a node in a blockchain network?
options: A computer that stores and validates blockchain data.
A block that is half-finished.
A password used to unlock the blockchain.
A database for user profiles.

questions.question: What is a wallet in blockchain?
options: A digital tool used to store and manage cryptocurrency keys.
A physical bag for holding coins.
A mobile app for online shopping.
A government ID card.

questions.question: What is a private key?
options: A secret code that allows access to your cryptocurrency.
A public blockchain address.
An encryption method for websites.
A password for social media accounts.

questions.question: What is a public key?
options: An address shared with others to receive cryptocurrency.
A password used to log in to websites.
A code used for decrypting movies.
A fingerprint stored on the blockchain.

questions.question: Why is blockchain considered secure?
options: Each block is linked with cryptographic hashes, making tampering extremely difficult.
It stores all data on one central server.
It allows anyone to edit previous blocks easily.
It hides transactions from all users.

questions.question: What does 'immutable' mean in blockchain?
options: Data once added cannot be changed or deleted.
Data can be freely edited by admins.
Blocks are temporary and get replaced weekly.
The blockchain automatically resets monthly.

questions.question: What is a hash in blockchain?
options: A unique fixed-length string that represents data and ensures integrity.
A network error code.
A storage folder for images.
A database for storing passwords.

questions.question: What does 'peer-to-peer' (P2P) mean?
options: Transactions happen directly between users without intermediaries.
Users must go through a bank server.
Data flows through government servers first.
It means all users share one account.

questions.question: What is the role of miners in blockchain?
options: They verify transactions and secure the network.
They send spam transactions to test security.
They build websites for crypto exchanges.
They store NFTs on USB drives.

questions.question: What is a gas fee in Ethereum?
options: A small fee paid to perform operations or transactions on the network.
The cost of electricity used for mining.
The charge for buying crypto on exchanges.
A subscription cost for blockchain users.

questions.question: What is a dApp?
options: A decentralized application that runs on blockchain technology.
A downloadable desktop application.
A browser extension for emails.
A type of blockchain mining tool.

questions.question: What does 'ledger' mean in blockchain?
options: A record of all transactions stored on the network.
A physical notebook for miners.
A document signed by the government.
A list of user passwords.

questions.question: What is the main benefit of blockchain?
options: Transparency, security, and data integrity without central control.
Complete anonymity for users.
Instant deletion of all data.
Higher taxes for crypto users.

questions.question: What is Proof of Work (PoW)?
options: A consensus mechanism requiring miners to solve puzzles to validate transactions.
A document proving ownership of coins.
A blockchain design used for testing.
A license for crypto traders.

questions.question: What is Proof of Stake (PoS)?
options: A consensus mechanism where validators are chosen based on how many coins they hold.
A system that destroys coins to prevent inflation.
A way to mine Bitcoin faster.
A file format for storing private keys.

questions.question: What is a blockchain explorer?
options: A tool that lets users view transactions and blocks on a blockchain.
A browser for cryptocurrency news.
A program for mining new blocks.
A wallet for storing tokens.

questions.question: What are NFTs?
options: Non-Fungible Tokens — unique digital assets stored on a blockchain.
Network File Transfers — a way to send data online.
Node Function Trackers for miners.
National Finance Tokens created by banks.

questions.question: What is a token?
options: A digital asset built on an existing blockchain.
A type of physical currency.
A hardware component in a miner.
A password reset key.

questions.question: Which of the following is a popular blockchain platform?
options: Ethereum
Photoshop
MySQL
Android Studio
